intro: Poupartia pubescens, commonly known as the woolly poupartia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Poupartia pubescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
